comments.content:
As you said, this is an older logo. I guess it's from the era before digital fonts and therefore it is hand-drawn lettering.

If you would be interested in similar fonts, we can try finding some candidates.

- Mike Yanega

Some loosely similars to play with: Fontmesa [La Macchina](http://web.archive.org/web/20140527134635/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontmesa/la-macchina), [Brewmaster Modern](http://web.archive.org/web/20140527134635/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontmesa/brew-master-modern) and [Draft Beer](http://web.archive.org/web/20140527134635/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontmesa/draft-beer), Doyald Young's [Home Run](http://web.archive.org/web/20140527134635/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/doyald-young/home-run) and [Eclat](http://web.archive.org/web/20140527134635/http:/www.linotype.com/148404/eclat-family.html), [Funkydori](http://web.archive.org/web/20140527134635/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/laura-worthington/funkydori), [Blenda](http://web.archive.org/web/20140527134635/http:/typophile.com/wiki/https%3A/%252Fwww.behance.net/gallery/Blenda-Script-Free-Font/13832171), [Lobster](http://web.archive.org/web/20140527134635/http:/www.impallari.com/lobster)
